member.name: T:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool
member.summary: This buffer pool is instance thread safe Use GetBuffer to get a MemoryStream (with a publically accessible buffer) Calling Close on this MemoryStream will clear its internal buffer and return the buffer to the pool for reuse MemoryStreams can grow larger than the DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE (or whatever you passed in) and the underlying buffers will be returned to the pool at their larger sizes

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool._bufferPoolStack
member.summary: The buffer pool stack

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool._bufferSize
member.summary: The buffer size

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
member.summary: The default buffer size

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool.GetBuffer
member.summary: Gets a MemoryStream built from a buffer plucked from a thread safe pool The pool grows automatically. Closing the memory stream clears the buffer and returns it to the pool

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.BufferPool.ReturnBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns the buffer using the specified buffer

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.IWebSocketClientFactory.ConnectAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.String,Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Connect with a stream that has already been opened and HTTP websocket upgrade request sent This function will check the handshake response from the server and proceed if successful Use this function if you have specific requirements to open a conenction like using special http headers and cookies You will have to build your own HTTP websocket upgrade request You may not even choose to use TCP/IP and this function will allow you to do that
member.param: The full duplex response stream from the server
The secWebSocketKey you used in the handshake request

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.PingPongManager.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the PingPongManager to facilitate ping pong WebSocket messages. If you are manually creating an instance of this class then it is advisable to set keepAliveInterval to TimeSpan.Zero when you create the WebSocket instance (using a factory) otherwise you may be automatically be sending duplicate Ping messages (see keepAliveInterval below)
member.param: The web socket used to listen to ping messages and send pong messages
The time between automatically sending ping messages. Set this to TimeSpan.Zero if you with to manually control sending ping messages.
The token used to cancel a pending ping send AND the automatic sending of ping messages if keepAliveInterval is positive

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions
member.summary: Client WebSocket init options

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the WebSocketClientOptions class

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: How often to send ping requests to the Server This is done to prevent proxy servers from closing your connection The default is TimeSpan.Zero meaning that it is disabled. WebSocket servers usually send ping messages so it is not normally necessary for the client to send them (hence the TimeSpan.Zero default) You can manually control ping pong messages using the PingPongManager class. If you do that it is advisible to set this KeepAliveInterval to zero for the WebSocketClientFactory

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.NoDelay
member.summary: Set to true to send a message immediately with the least amount of latency (typical usage for chat) This will disable Nagle's algorithm which can cause high tcp latency for small packets sent infrequently However, if you are streaming large packets or sending large numbers of small packets frequently it is advisable to set NoDelay to false This way data will be bundled into larger packets for better throughput

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.AdditionalHttpHeaders
member.summary: Add any additional http headers to this dictionary

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.IncludeExceptionInCloseResponse
member.summary: Include the full exception (with stack trace) in the close response when an exception is encountered and the WebSocket connection is closed The default is false

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.SecWebSocketExtensions
member.summary: WebSocket Extensions as an HTTP header value

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketClientOptions.SecWebSocketProtocol
member.summary: A comma separated list of sub protocols in preference order (first one being the most preferred) The server will return the first supported sub protocol (or none if none are supported) Can be null

member.summary: The WebSocket HTTP Context used to initiate a WebSocket handshake

member.summary: Server WebSocket init options

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the WebSocketServerOptions class

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketServerOptions.#ctor(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class
member.param: The include exception in close response

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketServerOptions.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketServerOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: How often to send ping requests to the Client The default is 60 seconds This is done to prevent proxy servers from closing your connection A timespan of zero will disable the automatic ping pong mechanism You can manually control ping pong messages using the PingPongManager class. If you do that it is advisable to set this KeepAliveInterval to zero in the WebSocketServerFactory

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketServerOptions.IncludeExceptionInCloseResponse
member.summary: Include the full exception (with stack trace) in the close response when an exception is encountered and the WebSocket connection is closed The default is false

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Network.WebSocketServerOptions.SubProtocol
member.summary: Specifies the sub protocol to send back to the client in the opening handshake Can be null (the most common use case) The client can specify multiple preferred protocols in the opening handshake header The server should use the first supported one or set this to null if none of the requested sub protocols are supported
